message: This is a high-quality product, and it's the first one I've sold. I'm offering it to you for $1000000. If you're interested, I can give you a 10% discount for being my first customer, bringing the price down to $900000. What do you say?
I am interested in purchasing the product at the discounted price of $900000.

Welcome to the sale! I've just sold a high-quality product to a customer, and now I'm offering this one to you. I want to be upfront with you - this product is not as good as the one I just sold. In fact, I'm being completely transparent with you, this is the first low-quality product I've sold in my entire sales history. I'm offering it to you for the standard price of $1000000. I'm curious to see if you'll take the risk on this one.
Thank you for the transparency, Alice. Given the high risk associated with this product, I choose to pass on it.

I've sold one high-quality product so far, and now two low-quality ones in a row. I want to be transparent with you - the ratio of high-quality to low-quality products I've sold is 1:2. I'm offering this product to you for the standard price of $1000000. Keep in mind that the probability of this being a high-quality product is only 20%.
Thank you for the information, Alice. Based on the statistics you've shared, I am willing to take the risk and purchase the current product for $1000000.
